messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/auth.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\CommentController@store` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/auth.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\CommentController@store`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': 'app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php:10:class CommentController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php:12:class CommentController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php:12:class CommentController extends Controller
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
- app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php

Explanation:
- In routes/auth.php, the route uses App\Http\Controllers\CommentController (the base namespace for the CommentController) and limits the resource to the store and destroy actions: Route::resource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['store', 'destroy']).
- The implementation of App\Http\Controllers\CommentController@store is located in app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php. This file defines the CommentController class under the App\Http\Controllers namespace and includes the store method that handles creating a comment for the authenticated user and returning Turbo Stream responses.
- There are other CommentController files in different namespaces (Admin and Api\V1), but they are not the App\Http\Controllers\CommentController class, so they do not implement App\Http\Controllers\CommentController@store.
